alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 9:59AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Penobscot County through 1030 AM EDT... At 959 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Howland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Howland, Springfield, Licoln Township, Lake View Plantation, Enfield, Lee, Lagrange, Mattawamkeag, Chester, Winn, Passadumkeag, Burlington, Lowell, Medford, Woodville, Maxfield, Seboeis and Cedar Lake. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 213 and 238. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
